text: [Music]
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale and on this
episode of Laura in the kitchen I'm
going to show you how to make pita
pizzas this is something that I came up
with with leftovers and it's something I
go to time and time again because it's
so quick and easy to make and you can
just use anything you've got left over
in your fridge it's a great like
cleaning out your fridge before you go
food shopping kind of recipe and exactly
this is exactly how I came along so for
the recipe you're going to be very few
ingredients you're going to need just
any leftover veggie you've got on hand
whether the raw or cooked I have gotten
something that is left over ready to be
on hand so I'm going to use that as my
topping you're going to need some
homemade marinara sauce you can use
store-bought
this is my marinara sauce you can get
the recipe to laurainthekitchen.com for
it and some mozzarella cheese or any
cheese you want and of course you're
gonna need your pita bread which these
are six inch six-inch pita bread so
again you can use any sauce you want you
can use an alfredo sauce if you've got
that leftover on hand and you could put
some grilled chicken on top if that's
what you have you can use whatever you
want as long as you've got pita bread
and you put the oven on 400 degrees
you've got whatever pizza you're desire
so having said that you want to put your
oven to 400 degrees and get that ready
for you and once you have everything
ready you're pretty much ready to pile
everything on and put it into the oven
so this is how I like to do it I take a
couple of tablespoons in this case I'm
only using a couple tablespoons of
marinara sauce because my ratatouille
already has tomatoes in it so I don't
want it to become too liquidy once
you've got your sauce on you just want
to pile on your veggies and I'm just
going to put about a quarter cup of
veggies on each one to scatter them
around so everything is nice and even
and if you want to get my recipe from my
home a ratatouille then just check out
Laura in the kitchen comm and you can
see how I like to make ratatouille it's
a little bit different than what most
recipes or you know known with most
recipes call for but this is just the
way I like to make it and to each his
own like I always say so now just finish
putting your veggies on the top and like
I said you can even use raw veggies you
know you can use like some sliced
mushrooms some bell peppers some red eye
and you can use pepperoni you can use
leftover chicken leftover steak you can
use anything really it song is it's
edible you can do whatever you want so
on top of your veggies I'm going to put
a few slices of mozzarella last bit of
mozzarella and now this is going to go
into my preheated oven at 400 for about
10 minutes and I'll show you what that
looks like once it's done and then we're
going to cut and serve a little pita
pizzas we're in the oven for about 10
minutes and that they're done them
cheese is melted the crust is nice and
crispy the pita I should say so now it's
time to cut right into it and you can
even use a whole wheat pita bread too
doesn't have to be a specific kind but
that is about it and it's really simple
and easy and you can use this for an
appetizer you can use this for lunch you
can do this for snap you can do this for
whatever time of day for whatever
occasion it's just simple and that's the
best kind of food and it's using
leftovers which I know some of us y know
me anyway I end up with little bits and
pieces of things so putting them
together it's just a fun experience and
it's a fun like experiment to see what I
can come up with just a few little
things it is hot ok ha ha mm-hmm mom
that is it I don't think you really need
a recipe for this but if you want to
know exactly how much I use of
everything go www.laurainthekitchen.com
to get the recipe I'll see you next time
bye bye
you
